duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and manage a team of Mechanical/Maintenance Technicians, overseeing their tasks and ensuring quality work.
Plan and monitor shift assignments, inspections, and annual assessments for technician employees.
Provide support to Technical Operations Team on site, including assistance with design reviews and planning/scheduling for installation of upgrades.
Participate in the development and execution of maintenance programs for new and existing subsystems.
Act as a point of contact to the leadership team, prioritize, schedule, and assign tasks, and report on progress and results.
Install, check out, and operate Mechanical sub-systems, systems, and equipment under the direction of a supervisory engineer.
Perform technical activities such as selection of components, assembly, troubleshooting, repair, and maintenance, independently or under the direction of a supervisory engineer.
Solve problems and assist in solving design problems, ensure compliance with technical requirements and safety standards.

education_certification.credential: Associate’s degree, military schools, or college level courses in Mechanical Engineering Technology or equivalent combination of trades/skill training and demonstrated work experience sufficient to meet job requirements.
Certification in Refrigerant Handling, EPA608 or equivalent training.
